qas.question: Which term is in reference to people from a Christian culture?
Which term is indicative of people who place their faith in Jesus?
What description is used for Western people who do not follow the Muslim faith?

plausible_answers.text: those with a religious faith in Jesus

qas.question: While Masihi refers to people from a Christian culture, what does Nasrani mean?
While Nasrani means those with a religious faith, what does Masihi refer to?
For whom does Masihi tend to be used more generically?
How do some countries refer to Muslim foreigners?
Which type of people are known as "religious people"?

context: Where there is a distinction, <a0_0><a2_0>Nasrani<a2_0/><a0_0/> refers to <b4_0>people from a Christian culture<b4_0/> and <a1_0>Masihi<a1_0/> means <b3_0>those with a religious faith in Jesus<b3_0/>. In some countries Nasrani tends to be used <b6_0>generically<b6_0/> for <b5_0><b7_0>non-Muslim Western foreigners<b7_0/><b5_0/>, e.g. "blond people."
